elements.brief: run JavaScript code, in the browser, from Lua
elements.description: Executes the supplied string as JavaScript inside the browser. A call to this function is blocking, the result is returned as-is, as a string. (Internally this will execute the string using the eval() JavaScript function.)
elements.examples:
local res = html5.run("10 + 20") -- returns the string "30"
print(res)
local res_num = tonumber(res) -- convert to number
print(res_num - 20) -- prints 10
elements.name: html5.run

elements.brief: set a JavaScript interaction listener callback from lua
elements.description:
Set a JavaScript interaction listener callaback from lua that will be
invoked when a user interacts with the web page by clicking, touching or typing.
The callback can then call DOM restricted actions like requesting a pointer lock,
or start playing sounds the first time the callback is invoked.
elements.examples:
local function on_interaction(self)
    print("on_interaction called")
    html5.set_interaction_listener(nil)
end

function init(self)
    html5.set_interaction_listener(on_interaction)
end
elements.name: html5.set_interaction_listener

parameters.doc:
The interaction callback. Pass an empty function or nil if you no longer wish to receive callbacks.
self
object The calling script
parameters.name: callback

info.description: HTML5 platform specific functions. The following functions are only available on HTML5 builds, the html5.* Lua namespace will not be available on other platforms.
info.name: HTML5
